page.title: 01Introduction- Colemere & Lee
page.content:
This rural area of Shropshire consists principally of farmland, arable and pasture.
There is also a sand and gravel company working a large gravel bed. We have several areas of woodland, both mixed deciduous and conifer and some fine free standing oaks. A few very old hedges remain.
There are 2 small villages, Colemere (434325)(pop. 65) and Lee (405324) (pop. 35) as well as a number of isolated farmhouses and farm cottages.
Colemere has a stonebuilt Church (438329) and Vicarage, while at Lee Bridges (405316) we find a small Methodist Chapel (405311) constructed of timber and corrugated iron.
